page.title: 07The Todmorden Flood of 1982
page.content: {An eye-witness account by Jon Wilson, {Robin Wood Junior School. My house was badly flooded in the disastrous flood of 1982.A thunder storm broke at 4.00pm and by 4.15pm the road was a river and water poured into the house. I helped my mum take things upstairs and looked through the bedroom window. I saw a car and dustbins floating down the road. Alot of mud was left behind;the road was chewed up and a house collasped with the strength of the water.T.V. cameras recorded the damage. People in Cornholme helped one another, to clean their houses, till very late at night and we had to live with my grandma for 3 months. The culverts, under the houses, have been cleaned out and repaired to stop it ever happening again.
